main-use-cases: As a knowledge base (including technical, non-fiction and encyclopaedic content);Worldbuilding (e.g. for role-playing games);Narrative fiction writing (either supporting its creation or directly writing in TiddlyWiki);Other
share-wikis: Yes, and I am the only editor/administrator of my wiki(s)
value-of-tw: makes it easy to find and organize information about my constructed languages, and my writing universes
tw-ability-level: I have customised TiddlyWiki through options and plugins;I am comfortable using WikiText widgets (e.g. <$transclude>, <$list>...);I have written custom HTML;I have written custom CSS styles
save-method: Multi-file wiki served through Node.js;Single-file wiki with TiddlyDesktop
backup-method: N/A - I keep my wiki on a single system

tw-customisations: I pretty much always make a custom stylesheet
project-strengths: I can't think of anything. The change from Classic to the version was a good change. The community is very helpful
project-weaknesses: documentation - it's either lacking or written for technical people. It'd be great if there was more written at a basic level
ok-to-publish: Yes, I am happy for my responses to be published
title: Community Survey 2025 Answer 00119
